item.description: Reconstruction of analytical amplitudes across loops, legs and theories </font face> arXiv:1904.04067 (JHEP) arXiv:1910.11355 with Daniel Maître IPPP Internal Seminar <img src="IP3_logo_blue.png”; style="max-width:280px;float:center;border:none;“> <img src="DurhamLogo.svg”; style="max-width:280px;float:center;border:none;“> Only speaker can read these. Press S to view. Table of Contents A. Reconstruction of analytical spinor-helicity amplitudes 1. Motivation 2. Singular limits 3. Partial fractions and ansatze 4. Rational coefficients in QCD B. Tree amplitudes from the CHY formalism

item.description: Analytical amplitudes from numerical evaluations arXiv:1904.04067 with Daniel Maitre IPPP - Durham University <img src="IP3_logo_blue.png”; style="max-width:280px;float:center;border:none;“> <img src="DurhamLogo.svg”; style="max-width:280px;float:center;border:none;“> Only speaker can read these. Press S to view. Table of Contents 1. Motivation and introduction 2. Singularity structure 3. Ansatz and amplitude reconstruction 4. Some results (Yang-Mills in the Standard Model) 1.1 Motivation Cross sections at hadron colliders are given by: $d\hat{σ}_{n}=\frac{1}{2\hat{s}}dΠ_{n-2};(2π)^4δ^4\big(∑_{i=1}^n p_i\big);|\overline{\mathcal{A}(p_i,μ_F, μ_R)}|^2$ </font size>
